title: [Large-Scale] Reinforcement Learning-Based Diabetes Treatment Recommendation System Development

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory statistics and programming concepts understanding
context.additional_context: Content design focusing on reinforcement learning implementation considering medical data characteristics, supporting smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: One can explain the fundamental principles of reinforcement learning (MDP, agent, reward function) and analyze their applicability to medical data.

Learners preprocess and normalize diabetes patient data (≥10 variables: blood glucose, insulin levels, weight) and implement a reinforcement learning pipeline in Python, formatting state-action-reward structures with ≥80% data transformation accuracy.
A simple treatment recommendation model reflecting medical constraints is implemented, and performance evaluation methods are applied.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
